item.title: A bit of help [PI](++)
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

So basically you’re saying that the NPC works, but when you use a teleport it also uses the NPC content? Change the NPC part you made to have a condition.

Example:

if (dialoguewhatever == whatever
whatever();

Read full topic

item.title: A bit of help [PI](++)
item.dc:creator: @Get_Forgotten Get_Forgotten
item.description:
@Get_Forgotten wrote:

Ok, I’ve added a npc that can alter the defense level of a player in dialogue but i’ve run across a small error it all works pretty much… but when I teleport It changes my level depending on which teleport i push… I’m using the same dialogue buttons I’m pretty much wandering if its possible to seperate the two methods so that it doesn’t call them together… I’ll show My class 9190

[code]case 9190:

			 if (c.teleAction == 1 && c.playerLevel[1] > 0 && c.dialogueAction != 20) {
				//rock crabs
				c.getPA().spellTeleport(2676, 3715, 0);
			} else if (c.teleAction == 2 && c.playerLevel[1] > 0 && c.dialogueAction != 20) {
				//barrows
				c.getPA().spellTeleport(3565, 3314, 0);
			} else if (c.teleAction == 3 && c.playerLevel[1] > 0 && c.dialogueAction != 20) {
				//godwars
				c.sendMessage("You teleported to Godwars... If everything is black Logout then back in!");
				c.getPA().spellTeleport(2882, 5310, 2);
			} else if (c.teleAction == 4 && c.playerLevel[1] > 0 && c.dialogueAction != 20) {
				//varrock wildy
				c.getPA().spellTeleport(2539, 4716, 0);
			} else if (c.teleAction == 5 && c.playerLevel[1] > 0 && c.dialogueAction != 20) {
				c.getPA().spellTeleport(3046,9779,0);
			} else if (c.teleAction == 20 && c.playerLevel[1] > 0 && c.dialogueAction != 20) {
				//lum
				c.getPA().spellTeleport(3222, 3218, 0);//3222 3218 
			}
			
			else if (c.dialogueAction == 106 && c.playerLevel[1] > 0 && c.dialogueAction != 20) {
				if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.diceID, 1)) {
				c.getItems().deleteItem(c.diceID, c.getItems().getItemSlot(c.diceID), 1);	
				c.getItems().addItem(15086, 1);
					c.sendMessage("You get a six-sided die out of the dice bag.");
				}
				c.getPA().closeAllWindows();
			} else if (c.dialogueAction == 107) {
				if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(c.diceID, 1)) {
					c.getItems().deleteItem(c.diceID, c.getItems().getItemSlot(c.diceID), 1);	
					c.getItems().addItem(15092, 1);
					c.sendMessage("You get a ten-sided die out of the dice bag.");
				}
				c.getPA().closeAllWindows();
			}
			if (c.dialogueAction == 10 && c.playerLevel[1] > 0 && c.dialogueAction != 20) {
				c.getPA().spellTeleport(2845, 4832, 0);
				c.dialogueAction = -1;
			} else if (c.dialogueAction == 11 && c.playerLevel[1] > 0 && c.dialogueAction != 20) {
				c.getPA().spellTeleport(2786, 4839, 0);
				c.dialogueAction = -1;
			} else if (c.dialogueAction == 12 && c.playerLevel[1] > 0 && c.dialogueAction != 20) {
				c.getPA().spellTeleport(2398, 4841, 0);
				c.dialogueAction = -1;
				return;
			
			}

			if (c.dialogueAction == 20 && c.has10Def ==  false && Config.doubleEXPWeekend == false) {
		 		c.playerXP[1] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(1);
				c.playerLevel[1] = 10;
		 		c.getPA().refreshSkill(1);
				c.getPA().addSkillXP((1156), 1);
			} else if (Config.doubleEXPWeekend = true) {
		 		c.playerXP[1] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(1);
				c.playerLevel[1] = 10;
		 		c.getPA().refreshSkill(1);
				c.getPA().addSkillXP((1156/2), 1);
				
			} else if (c.dialogueAction != 20) {
				return;
			}
			
		break;[/code]

if you can figure out what i did wrong in this case I’ll do the rest on my own

Read full topic
